Despite fears of @andrewrobertso5 carrying a minor knock, he will be fit for selection ahead of @CPFC on Saturday. #LFC

Emre Can remains a major fitness doubt for Liverpool’s Premier League trip to Crystal Palace after missing Thursday’s session at Melwood, writes @JamesPearceEcho

The good news for Jurgen Klopp is that Andy Robertson was fit to train after being forced off playing for Scotland against Hungary with a dead leg. (Echo)

Can continues to have treatment on the back problem which forced him off against Watford a fortnight ago and then ruled him out of Germany’s two friendlies. (Echo)

Mohamed Salah, Sadio Mané and Roberto Firmino all trained fully after reporting back to Melwood unscathed following their international commitments. (Echo)

Loris Karius says competing with Simon Mignolet is "not easy" and reveals why he has no regrets about leaving Manchester City as a teenager. (@SkySports)

Karius: “I just worked hard in training and then the games I had, I tried my best because you can only look at yourself and try to perform well.”

Karius: “I know I can improve on pretty much everything, I'm 24 now so there is a lot of space for improvement.”

Napoli midfielder Jorginho has hinted he would like to play in a side who play football like Jurgen Klopp's Liverpool.

The Italian international has been linked with a move to Liverpool, with suggestions the club have identified him as a possible summer target to bolster the midfield.

Although he did not name Liverpool by name, the Serie A star coyly admits the kind of football implemented at Anfield - as well as Manchester City, under Pep Guardiola - would be something he would enjoy.

"I think that I could fit (in the Premier League)," he told reporters. "It depends on who else is around me - I need players with the same characteristics that I have.

"There are English teams with this style of play, ball on the ground, quick transitions, high pressure.

"If one of those teams wanted me, I could fit and the other way round. My football way is not a usual one."

The German coach has instilled those qualities into his Liverpool side since taking charge in October 2015, and his side is renowned for their rapid counter attacks and devotion to pressing, much like Jorginho's current team.

So too, however, are City - and Guardiola has previously praised the 26-year-old, hailing him as 'marvellous' after a Champions League game between the two earlier this year.

Jorginho was flattered by the comments, but insists his focus for now remains on overhauling Juventus and delivering Napoli their first title since 1990.

"It's always nice to receive compliments, but it's spectacular when they come from a manager with that importance and winning past," Jorginho added.

"He's a global icon. All I can do is to be grateful. This is a consequence not just of my work but of all my team-mates in Napoli.

"I'm really keen to make history with Napoli and win the league."

Manchester United and Arsenal have also been linked with a move for the Brazilian-born star.

Source: Liverpool Echo

Liverpool will face both Manchester City and Manchester United during their pre-season tour of America this summer in the lucrative International Champions Cup, writes @JamesPearceEcho

Official confirmation will follow in the next fortnight but Jurgen Klopp's squad will be in the States from July 20 to July 28 and will play three matches. (Echo)

Liverpool’s clash with Manchester City is set to take place in New Jersey on July 25. The 82,000 capacity MetLife Stadium is the most likely venue. (Echo)

Michigan is set to host the game against United three days later at the Michigan Stadium, nicknamed 'The Big House', which holds 107,000. Roma are also potential opponents. (Echo)

replies.msg: Daniel Sturridge has cost West Bromwich Albion a staggering £50,000 a minute since his January loan move, but Alan Pardew has defended the signing of the Liverpool striker, writes @JPercyTelegraph

Jurgen Klopp has saluted Virgil van Dijk’s leadership qualities – but insists Jordan Henderson will retain the Liverpool captaincy, writes @JamesPearceEcho

Klopp: “Hendo and Virgil are leaders and that’s cool. But I am not half as much interested in the captaincy role as you all are.”

Klopp: “Hendo is doing an incredible job here. If you ask whether I am thinking about giving the armband to someone else then no.”

Klopp: “Do you need more than one player who feels responsible for the whole group? Yes of course. We have them and Virgil is one of them.”
